name: 1,3,5-tribromobenzene
Reason: The basic unit, benzene, has a melting point of 5.5 °C. Each bromine substituent substantially increases the molecular weight and size, creating stronger London dispersion forces. Additionally, the symmetry of the molecule with bromines at the 1,3,5- positions enhances the efficiency of molecular packing, further raising the melting point. We estimate each bromine to raise the melting point by approximately 40 °C over benzene. Therefore, the shift for three bromine atoms would be about 120 °C.
